metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0738 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
OpenStack Object Storage (Swift) before 2.3.1 (Kilo), 2.4.x, and 2.5.x before 2.5.1 (Liberty) do not properly close server connections, which allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (proxy-server resource consumption) via a series of interrupted requests to a Large Object URL.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0738` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

python-swift - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift-account - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift-container - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift-object - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift-object-expirer - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
swift-proxy - 1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Romain Le Disez and Ã–rjan Persson

criterions.comment: swift package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.13.1-0ubuntu1.5').
